metadata.title: Convert Hertz to Terahertz – Frequency Converter
metadata.description: Convert frequency from Hertz (Hz) to Terahertz (THz), useful for optical and infrared frequency analysis.

introduction: This converter transforms hertz to terahertz for ultra-high frequency measurement.
Terahertz frequencies bridge microwave and infrared regions.
This converter uses the relationship where 1 terahertz equals 1 trillion hertz.
methodology: 1 THz = 1,000,000,000,000 Hz. To convert Hz to THz, divide by 1 trillion.
Terahertz frequencies used in experimental imaging and spectroscopy.
Understanding frequency conversion is essential for optical engineering.
This converter provides precise frequency conversion.
examples: Example 2 – Visible light: ~500 THz = 500 trillion Hz.

faqs.question: What's a terahertz?
faqs.answer: 1 trillion hertz. Bridges microwave and infrared frequencies.

faqs.question: What uses terahertz?
faqs.answer: Experimental imaging, astronomy, spectroscopy, security screening.

faqs.question: How do I calculate wavelength?
faqs.answer: Wavelength = Speed of light / Frequency. At 1 THz: ~300 micrometers.

faqs.question: Is terahertz light?
faqs.answer: No, it's beyond microwave but before infrared. Not visible light.

faqs.question: Why use terahertz for imaging?
faqs.answer: Can penetrate clothing, some materials. Non-ionizing radiation (safer than X-ray).

faqs.question: Are terahertz devices commercial?
faqs.answer: Emerging. Expensive. Used in research and security. Mainstream soon.

faqs.question: What's beyond terahertz?
faqs.answer: Infrared, visible light, ultraviolet, X-rays, gamma rays (decreasing wavelength).
